Reviews.Title: “Probably the BEST of this price range”
Reviews.Author: jenaswright
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms at the Andrea Rivoli, Superior Double and Standard Twin. Superior room bed was smaller than a Queen, and there was about 1.5 feet on each side of the bed, a tiny desk, an armoir closet which was in the way and a 1-person-at-a-time bathroom - however it did have a nice view and good light from the two french-door windows which looked out over Rue Saint-Bon, a one-block long street with very little traffic. Standard Twin room was definitely larger, with much more room around the beds... it had a cute little (albeit nonworking) fireplace and one small window which looked out onto a wall about 3 feet away - very dark room, and absolutely no view. The bath was slightly smaller, no way more than 1 person at a time in the bathroom. Even though the decor was not particularly to my liking, both rooms and bathrooms were clean. The maids refold dirty towels and put them back on the towel rack, even when they are wet and dirty. They will bring new ones, however you have to ask for them in the morning - I guess they get locked up at night! They don't change sheets while you are occupying the room unless YOU remove the sheets and put them on the floor (?!?). Teeny-tiny elevator, send your bags up and you take the stairs! Breakfast was boring - mediocre coffee, same croissants, bread, boiled eggs (do-it-youself) canned fruit, yogurt and foil-wrapped, processed cheese EVERY SINGLE DAY - no variation what so ever. For 9 euros, you can do better within a block or two - unless you are just in a hurry, it is very convenient. Front desk staff was very, very helpful (if you could catch them NOT on the phone), happy to make dinner reservations, help with Metro questions, etc. They have a computer (stand up to use it) for guests' use, and a good selection of maps and tourist information readily available. The hotel is very conveniently located 1 block from the Hotel De Ville Metro stop and four blocks from the Chatelet Metro stop. You can walk to the Latin Quarter or the Louvre in less than 10 minutes easily. The Marais is full of fun little restaurants and bars, quite a few in less than 5 minute walk. If you are on a budget, and would rather spend your $$$ on other things besides the hotel while in Paris, the Hotel Andrea Rivoli would be an excellent choice. Just don't make plans to stay here expecting robes and slippers and chocolates on your (hard) pillow every night - not going to happen!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: modesttraveller30s
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed in this hotel and I enjoyed it on both occasions. Check-in is at 2:30 p.m., so that is good to keep in mind when planning a trip. The room was clean, comfortable and had access to a small balony that overlooked the street. The bed was comfortable. Wifi worked fine; ask for the code at the reception. We didn't eat breakfast there but there are several good places to eat nearby. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Phil__cleeve
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Hotel Andrea Rivoli for three nights in October 2011. The hotel is very well located on the edge of the lively Marais area, a few minutes walk from the Hotel de Ville, Ile de la Cite, the Pompidou Centre and the Louvre. Very close to metro stations at Hotel de Ville and Chatelet, which is only seven stops from Gare du Nord for the Eurostar. The rooms although not large and with relatively limited storage space are clean and comfortable. Our room (103) overlooked rue Saint Bon but the double glazing meant the room was quiet with very little noise from the nearby rue de Rivoli. The bathroom had a good sized and very efficient shower. The flat screen TV certainly had BBC World in English and I believe some other English language channels (although we spent very little time watching TV)! Breakfast at 9 euros was reasonable value and included juice, yogurt, fruit, croissants & preserves, mini pain au chocolat, small bread rolls, processed cheese, eggs and an egg boiler, toast, coffee and tea. Service at breakfast and throughout the hotel was friendly and efficient at all times (although some staff do not speak English and speaking a little French certainly helps). My only criticism of the hotel was the quality of the wi-fi signal, which in our room was weak, variable and sometimes non-existent. That is the only reason that this is a four star and not a five star review. However, please remember that this is a small two star hotel in Paris and structure expectations accordingly! We paid 104 euros per night and I consider that we had good value for money for such a well located hotel in the centre of Paris

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in excellent area”
Reviews.Author: Mrnick99
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed here for three nights in October 2011. We came for a fun weekend of eating, drinking and sightseeing and a day at Longchamp to experience the fantastic Prix de l'Arc Triomphe. Hotel Andrea Rivoli proved an excellent choice with loads of bars and restaurants within two minutes walk. Metro stops only 5 minutes walk and The Seine about 7 minutes away. The area is also full of retro furniture and clothes shops which were a lovely distraction. The hotel rooms were cleaned daily, the staff very helpful and friendly. The rooms are not very large but at under €100 per night fantastic value. I would certainly recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smmcilveen
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel, for location, service, ambiance and security. The Seine, Muse De Orsay and Louvre are all within easy walking distance. The superior rooms are extremely comfortable, the concierge very helpful,breeakfasts lovely and great security. Plus great restaurants just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware!”
Reviews.Author: 991Fotigo
Reviews.Content: Rooms rather small, but very good location, cleanliness, affordability. We were aware of all these, and more or less we found what we expected for 102 euro (classic double) for a week in May 2011. What we did not expect are the following: a) The wi-fi in our room (second floor) was either not working at all or was very, very slow. Having to send reports to our magazine everyday we had a really hard time. b) The hotel was in the process of intense renovation, in other words people were working the whole day (8.00-17.00) and the front of the hotel was covered by scaffolding. Nobody informed us about this in advance and there was no relevant indication in the web site. c) The noise (drilling, hammering, banging, hitting etc.) was terrible. When returning late (15.00) for a little rest, after a 6 hour strolling in the city, we could not stay for a moment, so we had to leave and find refuge in a nearby park or garden. d) The only view from our balcony, "overlooking" rue Saint Bon, was the scaffolding, the balcony floor was full of dust and debris and sometimes the workers were outside our window. The combination of noise, dirt and human presence made it impossible to open the window; worse, sometimes we had to draw our curtains to protect our privacy; worse still, one day, when we tried to open our window, we were told by a worker that the floor of the balcony needed to be left to dry up, because it was just cemented. In the hot days life in the room was simply unbearable. Imagine a dark room (lighting in the room unacceptable) and two people either leaving it in terror or waiting patiently until 17.00 for the workers to stop, unable to relax or work. We were extremely distressed not being able to feel comfortable in our room and having to walk around Paris from morning till late in the afternoon to avoid the noise and generally the unpleasant conditions. e) We complained from the first day to the staff in the reception and the only thing we managed, apart from earning their sympathy, was to hear that they were very very sorry. We sent two detailed email messages to the hotel manager, but to no avail. Only a short note from the reception that they were again very sorry, that they understand our problems, but nothing could be done. f) Before departure we insisted that, since we did not get what we paid for, the least the hotel should do as a symbolic gesture was to reduce the rate from 102 to 95 euro, that is, to the cost of a room not â€œoverlookingâ€� the street but seeing to the yard. The manager never appeared, but, through the person in the reception, informed us that the full amount will be immediately withdrawn from our credit card! We were amazed to see that they did not regard as their responsibility to keep their part of the agreement. As far as their behavior is concerned the least we could say is that we thought of it as highly unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “If I go to Paris again, I will stay there”
Reviews.Author: Aklu
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel because of the low rate for such an excellent central location. It was recommended to me by someone who stayed there 15 years ago. It is 2 star family owned hotel. It is a small hotel, and everything seems to be small inside (especially the lift), but it had everything we needed. We stayed there for 3 nights, the beds were comfortable and the room was very quiet. The lady in the reception was very friendly and helpful. The check in time is 2pm, and we arrived at 10am, and were allowed to put the luggage in the room. Also after we checked out we could leave our suitcases at reception until the evening. We did not have breakfast there so can't say anything about the food. This is not a luxury hotel, but if you are after a cheap accommodation in the heart of Paris, and don't like staying in backpackers, you will definitely get the value for money there.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: joaomalha
Reviews.Content: Just arrived two days ago from Paris and Andrea Rivoli Hotel was indeed the right choice. Simple, clean, good taste and cheap. All you want to get and above all, right in the middle of Rue de Rivoli. Of course it isn't a five star hotel, but deserves maximum rate if measuring the price-quality relationship. If you are looking for a place to stay just to get some sleep at night this is it. The breakfast was ok as well. Nothing too fancy but it has the basics (bread, croissants, coffee, milk, tea). Only one thing to be aware of: everything is small. If you are a tall person (about 1,85m or more) forget it. You will not fit in the shower neither on the elevator. I'm not that tall, neither my girlfriend, so it wasn't a problem at all. But if you are tall or large, I wouldn't recommend it. But that is the only exception. The staff was friendly and it has free wifi which was also great! And the photos on their website are exactly what you get! Completely real. Congrats. Nice hotel you have here!

Reviews.Title: “I always stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: giabee
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Andrea Rivoli three times in the past. Clean rooms, nice location and friendly staff. Wireless is slow but the location is close to a metro stop and across from the Hotel DeVille. The breakfast is basic but good.

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged for guaranteed reservation.”
Reviews.Author: RRJ_CA
Reviews.Content: My husband and daughter stayed at Hotel Andrea for 4 nights in July, great location. We reserved a double months in advance, however, when we arrived, the hotel had overbooked the doubles and placed us in a triple for the first night. The second night, we were moved to a double. Upon checkout, we were surprised to see that we were actually charged for the triple for the first night - and not the double per our confirmed reservation. I followed up with management by email to correct the charge but was told the manager was on vacation for 6 weeks and the staff were unable to assist until the manager reviewed the charge. I followed up with the manager again 6 weeks later and never received a response. As others have indicated in their reviews of this hotel, management is not particularly helpful or warm - particularly to North Americans. I plan to take another trip to Paris next fall, stay in the same neighborhood but at a different hotel. I recommend you do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Free Wi-Fi mostly a miss - bed is too hard”
Reviews.Author: mission2go
Reviews.Content: We loved Paris. There are many beautiful sights, lots of walking, and some wonderfully friendly French people. We selected Andrea Rivoli for one week for a few reasons: cost, location, free WI-FI. The location was okay, close enough to Chatelet and Hotel de Ville Metro, on the far reaches of the cool Le Marais area and in walking distance to the Louvre. The hotel is on a seemingly abandoned side street, away from the noise of Rue Rivoli. The cost was okay, a 2 star hotel for 102 Euros a night. I tried to reserve 10 other hotels but those were fully booked because of a fashion trade show. The continental breakfast was an extra 8.5 Euros. We chose the pastry shops - quiche/sandwiches/croissants/juice - for less. The room and bathroom were small, but we managed. However, the bed gave us muscle aches because the mattress felt like there was absolutely no cushioning, almost like a box spring. We woke up with back and neck aches every day. Our view outside was of a wall. We opted for 2 twin beds, as opposed to a double because we are Americans used to sharing a king size bed. There was a lift, which bypassed us if there was already someone else on there. We were 5 floors up and the spiral staircase looked intimidating. It was crucial that we had wi-fi, for work and to plan our day. However, I could almost never load a website page though I lucked out with email about 75% of the time. No one at the front desk could help us. Some of the staff insisted that no one else had this problem, and others said the internet connection wasn't consistent. Though, when I needed to check my email one night and it didn't work, one of the staff members was kind enough to let me use the front computer. Another time, the staff member wanted me to pay to use the computer, but finally allowed us free access. By the way, I am writing this email from Bruge, the same day we left Paris. I'm having no problems, at all, with my computer here. One final comment. We needed a taxi to the train station as we had heavy bags, not something you want to deal with more than once on the metro. The night staff member was challenged with finding a taxi for us in the morning. When we left in the morning, we had found out that a shuttle was ordered for us - 35 Euros instead of 12 with a taxi. That really aggravated us. As an American, we add an extra 28% for our currency exchange.

Reviews.Title: “Very fair deal for price, location, cleaniness”
Reviews.Author: freakytsz
Reviews.Content: Went there on an impulsive weekend, we tried our luck looking for a hotel in the center just on the spot - we were very happy with Andrea Rivoli, reasonable price, excellent location, rather calm given that it doesn't face a main road. Rooms are recently refurbished, very basic but that's the budget. Next to it is also an underground car park which is good since we needed to leave the car. Good compromise given it was an impulsive trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value - Great Find for Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: PlanesTrainsAutos09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with friends for a weekend in February (late review - apologies!). It had been recommended to us by another friend who had lived for some time in Paris and I have to say I will definately be passing on the recommendation. Great location away from the usual 'tourist' hotels and close to areas where the french themselves dine in nice little restaurants and coffee shops. Great shopping minutes within walking distance (fab Mango store right outside the door of the hotel!!). 5-10 mins walk to Notre Dame so very convenient to link up with city tour bus. Also convenient for rail station heading to Euro Disney which we did for a day. The hotel is not plush in any way so if that is what you are looking for then this is not the place for you. The staff are really friendly and helpful. We did not dine here at all but there is breakfast available also. Would I recommend - YES. Will I return - YES

Reviews.Title: “Just one night, but nice”
Reviews.Author: bay traveler
Reviews.Content: Had to check out of our weekly rental and checked into the hotel andrea rivoli for the last night of our stay. The hotel is small for our big american bods', especially the elevator. But, the staff was very friendly and courteous. The room was cozy and the bathroom was fine and had a real standup shower. Everything was clean. We didn't use the breakfast available in the morning as we had to make one last trip to our favorite boulangerie Julien, which was just around the corner. The room was quiet, the airconditioning worked, and we had a reasonable walk to the RER for the trip to the airport. A success in my book, and at a reasonable price for a great location in a large busy city.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms smells smoke!”
Reviews.Author: Fr2009
Reviews.Content: I went in this hotel in my honeymoon, but It was a terrible experience. The room that the hotel reserve to me, has a very strong smell of smoke. I try to change the room, but the atendents was to much unhelpful. They made jokes with my situation and said the hotel didn't has obligation of change my room. After spent many hours trying to acchieve a solution, I needed to change the hotel. I never had felt so bad, how I felt in this hotel. The hotel want to earn money and don't worry with the satisfaction of your guests.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, small hotel”
Reviews.Author: OnTheGo2005
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before. For us, it's a good location. The rooms are small, but nice. The staff is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The location is very good, but the manager/owner is unprincipled and unhelpful.”
Reviews.Author: Pirkitta
Reviews.Content: We called to book a standard dble room for 95Euros a night. Upon talking to a staff member, we were convinced to book rm #504 because it had a balcony and was generally a nicer room. We were guaranteed #504 and that was why I was willing to pay 115E. Upon our arrival we were not given #504, instead someone who had booked it at least a month later was given that room. The manager/owner made that mistake, would not acknowledge it, refused to move us to a standard room, or to lower the price to what we had originally tried to book. She was rude and would not acknowledge her error, insisting it was our fault, stating things like'we are so much cheaper than North American hotels', to which I responded, 'you should visit North America, and see what you can get for 115E($180). Besides, that had nothing to do with the issue, for we love Paris and the area, and the hotel was absolutely fine. She refused to understand and blamed it on her staff that they should not have guaranteed that room. But, she has trained her staff, who by the way did not understand why we were not given that room. It had been handwritten, attached to our reservation, that #504 was for us and could not be changed. So, we had to pay an extra 20E for something we did not get, with no acceptance of responsibility from the manager/owner, Aurelie Bringuier, It is not a lot of money, but it is the principle of her dishonesty, in getting extra money for a room that did not deserve this. Thus, the disappointment of not getting the balcony we had been promised and having to pay for it anyway, took away from the pleasure of the positive aspects of the location and relatively moderate cost. Friends that had gone to that hotel prior to us made comments also about the unhelpfulness of this manager. They did not have issues with unfair costs for they had just booked the lower priced standard room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for what it is”
Reviews.Author: nicvtheworld
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderfully located. It is on the edge of the Marais district which has tonnes of character and lots of little laneways to explore. It is a stones throw from Notre Dame and right near a metro station. I stayed in a single room which whilst small (it's a hotel in the centre of a major European city after all!) and simply furnished but was clean and quiet and suited my needs perfectly. This is a great choice if you're the sort of traveller who just requires somewhere basic but decent to rest your head at night and somewhere that's a handy base to explore the amazing sights Paris has to offer. That said they do have fancier rooms available!

Reviews.Title: “Hot spot and good price”
Reviews.Author: CESARCARDOSO
Reviews.Content: IÂ´ve been to the hotel Andrea Rivoli on april 2008 and liked a lot. The hotel is small but, in Paris, the important thing is to be near everything. ItÂ´s one blook from Notre Dame and two blooks from Louvre. ItÂ´s not noisy and near the subway (estation Hotel de Ville). The staff is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: robertkc1979
Reviews.Content: This hotel had good reviews on Trip Advisor and the price was great (for Paris), so we picked it for our 4 day stay in Paris. The room was very tiny (even smaller than our London hotel). The bathroom was barely a second room-no space for toiletries in the bathroom and a very small shower stall (with lots of mildew). You have to leave your key at the desk when you leave-which was annoying when we were just running around the corner to pick up breakfast and bring it back to the room. We arrived at the hotel on my birthday, so my husband had contacted the hotel in advance to ask if they could put a single rose in our room-he was told that they would take care of it and he gave them his credit card number. When we arrived, there was no rose and no one ever mentioned the incident (luckily-his card wasn't charged). The most annoying incident was trying to arrange a taxi. We wanted to take a taxi to the train station since we were heading to Germany next. We called the man at the front desk the evening before our final day and he told us to call back in the morning. When we called in the morning, the woman told us to call back when it was closer to the time we wanted the taxi. We needed the taxi at 1030am. When we called again, the woman told us to call 20 minutes prior to needing the taxi. So at 10:10am, we told her that we were ready for the taxi and she refused to call the taxi until we were downstairs with our luggage because "the taxi could arrive in 2 minutes or 2 hours!" So, we grabbed our luggage and went back downstairs to check out. Luckily, the taxi did arrive quickly, but there was no help from the front desk with communicating (we spoke very little French) to the taxi driver. When we got in the taxi, we realized that the taxi driver had been running the meter the entire time he was trying to get our luggage in the taxi! The hotel is in a great location-we were able to walk to Notre Dame, the Louvre and the subway station is only 2 blocks away. We felt safe walking near the hotel after dark also.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: reesapeesa
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in this hotel last year and was happy with it so we decided to stay here again on our 2nd trip to Paris. Overall, it's a descent hotel. Clean, friendly staff and very quiet! On our first night, due to jetlag, my husband and I ended up sleeping for 16 hours (this has never happened before!). They have double paned windows so as soon as you close it, you don't here anything at all!!! Very quiet. I knew about the rooms with 'courtyard' view as I peeked into one of the courtyard view rooms last year. Those rooms are 80 euro vs 89 euro for the street view rooms but totally worth it. It's nice to be able to open the windows and see Paris! As for location, the hotel advertises themselves as being in the Marais. Well, it's not really in the Marais and you don't really get the Marais vibe by staying here. You get more of the Rue de Rivoli vibe with the busy shopping street and not the quaint Marais. I'm not sure if I will stay here again. It's a fantastic hotel for the price but if you really want to stay in the heart of the Marais, this hotel is not for you. Hotel Jeanne d' Arc is a hotel right in the centre of Marais which is another hotel we stayed at in Paris for 89 euro / night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneLizzard
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this lovely, little, boutique style hotel for 5 nights on our 1st (and sad to say, only) visit to Paris in 2007. But we will definitely be back and we'll definitely stay at this lovely little hotel again. The positioning of the hotel in the gorgeous little area of Marais was 2nd to none. Everything was just a short stroll away (the Seine, Louvre, Notre Dame to name but a few) and should you wish to venture further the metro was only a minute or so walk away. The Hotel De Ville is delightful (and absolutely spectacular lit up at night) and a lovely place to sit and people watch for a 'breather' and only a mere minutes walk away from the hotel. The hotel room was all that we wanted it to be (and a little more with two gorgeous 'Parisienne' balconies that we would sit and people watch first thing in the morning). We stayed in Room 604 and we certainly weren't disappointed. The room was furnished with a decent sized double bed, small table and chairs and the ensuite bathroom wasn't as tiny as many other hotel bathrooms in Europe. So we were very pleased indeed. This was our first visit to Paris so we weren't intending to stay in our hotel room all day and all night so it was more than adequate to come home to after a very full day of exploring the sights and sounds of beautiful Paris. Even though it is located on a very busy street, the hotel itself is just slightly up from the main thoroughfare on a very quiet alley and therefore we did not experience much noise late at night at all and were able to get very good nights sleep on all our nights there. As other reviewers have stated - this is NOT a luxuriously appointed 5 star hotel. It does however fulfill its promises of being clean, tidy and relatively spacious for european standards. We didn't take up the offer of breakfasts at the hotel instead opting to walk down the street and try the many bakeries (we weren't disappointed with the quality of the gorgeous croissants on offer!). We always felt safe returning to the hotel late at night which was an added bonus. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel for anyone wishing to stay in a reasonably priced hotel that is close to everything. The staff were wonderful and very kind (especially having to listen to me trying to talk my very limited French to them) and as others have said, if you try and speak French to the French they are always much more willing to help you. Will definitely be back one day. Liz and Ian, Melbourne, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for this price”
Reviews.Author: ACIsrael
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels for this price. The location is AMAZING, just a few meters from rue de Rivoli, but the room was quiet. The staff was very nice. Clean room, reasonable size (it is in Europe after all). Nothing fancy, but everything you need is there. Be sure to ask for a room at the front and not the back - the nack rooms are quite stuffy and, obviously, there's no view. TV's only in french. But if all you need is a hotel to stay for the night, with a clean and nice bed / towels and a clean bath - that's the hotel for you. Location is ebverything - it's a 3 minute walk to Hotel de Ville. Lots of shops, resaturants etc. in the nearby area. Really great.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location a litlle budget”
Reviews.Author: So80
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, 5 minutes walking to Louvre. The rooms are small but very clean. The location is safe and breakfast is good compares to the bistro.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Andrea Rivoli”
Reviews.Author: laceyann22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in close proximity to everything Paris. If something is not close then it is just a quick stop on the Subway. We really enjoyed our stay here. The room is not nearly as small as most Paris hotels and it is clean and the AC works very well. It is a great bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TheRoadtoMajastres
Reviews.Content: This place is in a great location for your average Paris tourist. We were able to walk to everything we wanted to see, and it's only a few blocks from the metro if you need that. It's surrounded by cafes and places to eat, but it's very quiet because it's down a side street with little else on it. There was a nightclub on the street, but it was shut down when we were there and didn't show any signs of reopening. The room was small but cozy and clean. The only time it got noisy was when a crazy Spanish woman in the next room yelled at her husband every morning. The room also has a small safe. The front-desk and cleaning staff were friendly and helpful. You can rent Internet time on a computer in the lobby if you need it. Lovely area too -- lots of great old buildings and fun alleyways. Overall a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Andrea, Paris. Keenly priced, fantatsic location.”
Reviews.Author: tombolaUK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in room 403 at the Hotel Andrea for 5 nights. Price was a reasonable 88 euros for a double room with en-suite shower room, local TV and air con. The hotel is clean and the staff are helpful. Room was cleaned daily. We didn't try the continental breakfast on offer as we felt it was a little expensive at 9 euros per head. The location of the hotel was excellent, only two streets back from the river Seine, I'l de Cite was a 5 minute walk as was the nearest Metro (Chatelet). The rooms are across 6 floors with a lift which was a real boon with almost a weeks worth of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: oigevalt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Andrea Rivoli in May 07 and absolutely loved it. The location is the best in Paris if you prefer to be close to Latin Quarter and Le Marais. It's located just across Hotel De Ville and is 5 minutes walk from the Pompidou and less than 10 minutes walk from Notre Dame. The hotel itself is fairly basic and the rooms are quite small but cozy, with a good bathroom, it has an elevator (not to be taken for granted if you have to climb 5 floors with your luggage), clean, quiet, efficient and centrally located, with lots of great restaurants nearby. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: pno2ner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 5 nites and were very satisfied. I would characterize this as a mini-hotel. Everything is small, but very efficient and everything works. The location is excellent, off on a side street so its quiet, but near bus and subway stations. It seems a safe area and is also close to Notre Dame, St. Chapelle, Hotel de Ville, Pompidou Museum, and Louvre and the Seine. NOT near Montmartre, Sacre Ceour or Eiffel Tower. There is a small grocery store across the street and many bars and restaurants nearby. Across the Seine are many small pedestrian alleys that look like a food court in a mall. Lots of ethnic choices either to dine in or take out. Rooms are modern, very clean and plenty of HOT water. No washcloths, very firm beds, room telephones and 6 channels of French TV. Elevator and internet available at 1 euro=10 min. Tour info flyers are limited, but the hotel staff are very courteous and eager to help you find and get to your destination. We didn't use their breakfast as it didn't seem worth the extra 9 euro each. We were thoroughly satisfied and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: frankinto
Reviews.Content: A good way to save in a city such as Paris, where there is so much to see, is to forget about getting a luxurious hotel room. My partner and I chose room 603 on the top floor of this very conveniently located hotel. It had a very small bathroom, a couple of chairs, a table and two small balconies - perfect for our purposes. The elevator was down for a couple of days, but we just took it in stride. The staff was quite pleasant, and the breakfast items were always fresh. I would return. A word of advice that one cannot repeat enough: Don't automatically expect everyone to be fluent in English. If you try to speak a little bit of French you will get a very good response and better attitude from service staff, at this hotel and elsewhere. I am a French Canadian, so this is no problem for me, but my partner, who is an American, did make an effort and was amply rewarded. However, the Andrea is a budget hotel; don't expect top-flight concierge service. It is more suitable for independent travelers who don't need too much hand-holding.

Reviews.Title: “Room smelled horribly”
Reviews.Author: BlueGirlTravel
Reviews.Content: I have walked into this hotel, after a bad experience with an ETAP. So I though ok...it's on Rue Rivoli, one of the best locations, right? I was willing to pay whatever, to get a good room and some sleep for a change! Boy was I WRONG! The stay at this hotel is one of the worst experiences (if not the worst) I have ever had in my life. And remember, I was coming from an ETAP (budget hotel for students). I have asked for a single room...someone took me to a room which had a view towards an interiour court of some kind..or a big boiler..I have no idea, to this day, what that was! Ok, so not too much light...I wasn't upset about that. The bed was comfortable...But as I lay there, I started to realize ther's a very strange, sweet, garbage-like odor in the room. I started to look around...the carpet was very dirty, with stains..or mold? I don't know where the smell was coming from. It was so disgusting that I had to sleep with the window open at a time when there were around 5-6 degrees celsius (40-45 F) outside. I had all my t-shirts and sweaters on me, just to make it through the night. I can't call that a night's sleep b/c I woke up all the time, sickened with the smell and the cold. In the morning I had asked for my money back (I had paid in advance for more nights) and RUN from that place. That sweet, garbage -like smell I think will stay with me always. I can feel it if I think about it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel in the heart of the city.”
Reviews.Author: UnkleTomas
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in a Great location. Very quiet, considering it's right off of one of the main streets in Paris. Great staff. Rooms are decent size, and clean. Breakfast costs extra, so we ate around the corner at a bakery for cheaper. other than that no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience!”
Reviews.Author: blondedawn
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. As others have said, the location CANNOT be beat -- we returned to Paris later in the same trip and stayed in a different hotel in a more residential area in the 12th, and while it was pleasant, we definitely longed for the location and convenience of Hotel Andrea Rivoli. Our room was not their cheapest (it was 98 euros for two people), but it had a delightful little balcony that we enjoyed -- very Parisian! Room was tiny but spacious enough for us to move about. We found everything clean. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely return! PS -- there are two supermarkets within a 3 minute walk from the hotel, which we used quite a bit for self-catering. Wine was especially well-priced (2 euros for a bottle). To reach: walk down Rue Saint Bon past the hotel, away from Rue Rivoli. Pass the ramp to the underground parking garage (which should be on your left), walk up the stairs and continue until you hit the next road. Turn right -- supermarkets will be a few yards down.

Reviews.Title: “location on a super spot”
Reviews.Author: arjanliesker
Reviews.Content: we found the ANDRA RIVOLI HOTEL in the MARAIS(4) ideally situated to get to know the MARAIS. staff was very friendly, the entrance adequate, but the room very small, no wardrobe, just a rail, and the bathroom was minute as well. the beds were good, the carpets dirty, not only in the room, but also on the stairs. no view whatsoever, but that didn't bother us, we weren't there during the day! what bothered us more, was the fact, that the airconditioning broke down during the weekend, and couldn't be repaired right away, that made our room hotter, than we wanted! from there we were very close to all we needed and wanted to experience: very nice restaurants(try 'BOFINGER', near the place de la bastille, excellent surroundings, food and staff, a menu for about 30 euros!) also the little terraces, shops and bakeries, where we had our croissant and espresso, were nearby. in the evening some of the gay bars where we wanted to go, were almost right on our doorstep, so no problems getting to the hotel, late at night, when there is no METRO anymore to take you home. in all, a hotel to come back to, but they might clean or replace the carpets!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennifer1347
Reviews.Content: I must agree with the other reviews and say that this hotel has a great location. It was also easy to find. The lobby is nice but our room was a little drab. The carpet and comforter were dingy, as were the walls. But overall it was ok. The bathroom was small but clean. Unfortunately, the shower would alternate between hot and cold depending on if someone in the hotel flushed the toilet or turned on the water. The TV only had French channels. I wasn't expecting there to be English channels, but it would have been nice. Watching "Gladiator" in French just isn't the same - especially when you don't speak French. This was the only hotel in our two week vacation to charge for the internet. That was a disappointment. If you are like me and enjoy each night looking up the things you saw that day, it can get expensive! Our room did have two lovely windows. We could hear the scooters if we kept the windows open. Fortunately we aren't light sleepers so it was fine. The staff was helpful on several occasions. The only complaint I have about the staff is that the maid would wake us up every morning singing in the hallway and banging her cart into the walls. We could hear everything that went on in the hallway. Every door that was slammed and every footstep. Overall, this hotel is decent for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sarah05
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning and end of our recent two-week trip to France. Overall it was a decent budget hotel but the highlight is definitely its location. It is within walking distance of many of the major sites (i.e. Notre Dame, Louvre) and close to several different metro stations. Many shops, restaurants, cafes around the hotel. We stayed in two different rooms, both were extremely small. The tiny bathrooms were modern, but the rooms themselves were pretty old and drab. On the plus side, even though we were near a major street we didn't hear much street noise. Also the AC worked well. Overall I would consider staying here again mainly based on the convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Value”
Reviews.Author: julphil
Reviews.Content: This was a hotel recommended for its location. Located in Paris, walking distance to everything!! Rooms are clean although small, own bathroom which is a luxury and a lift, so no dragging the suitcases up staircases. Staff friendly and helpful. Two blocks form the Hotel De Ville and the River Seinne.
